text: Collectors is the industry leader

in authentication and condition
grading of collectibles.

The technology that we had kept us from
growing beyond $1,000,000,000 company.

However, thanks to the scalable technology
that we built on AWS,

we were able to grow from $1 billion
to $4.3

billion a year and a half later,
as $1,000,000,000 company,

we had reached a cap of where
our technology could actually get us.
So without building scalable

infrastructure to allow us
to handle higher volumes of customers,

we wouldn't be able to achieve
greater success as an organization.

We had this platform where
we were bringing together a whole bunch

of these organizations,
but also bringing forward our legacy

that 36 years of old technology
that we wanted to modernize

that was currently on On-Prem servers
that we want to bring to the cloud.

So what we were able to do
there was slowly migrate

a lot of the infrastructure over
by building new services in us

and on that platform, migrate over
from the older platform

and bring over the old data
and the old services and applications.

Moving to AWS actually allowed us
to scale up to such a point that we could

handle 850,000 transactions
in the final critical hours of an auction,
allowing us to exceed

in the level of revenue that we were able
to bring in with every auction.

And more importantly,
allow people who were bidding on

those items to have confidence
that their bids went through

and were able to actually bid
and win these items.

Within both experiences, AWS served us
quite well because of its adaptability,

and we were fortunate enough again
to work with a lot of specialists

on the AWS side to meet
both of those very different needs.

And so I can say with confidence
that AWS works

well for both small startups
and very scrappy organizations,

as well as much more refined,
older, mature organizations.
